text: MACBETH
So foul and fair a day I have not seen.
translation: MACBETH
I have never seen a day that's both so beautiful and so terrible.

text: BANQUO
How far is't call'd to Forres? What are these
translation: BANQUO
How much longer until we reach Forres? And who are these

text: So wither'd and so wild in their attire,
translation: that look so old and and bizarre? They don't look like

text: That look not like the inhabitants o' the earth,
translation: They don't even look like they're from Earth,

text: And yet are on't? Live you? or are you aught
translation: but still they're standing here. Are you alive?

text: That man may question?
translation: Can you even answer my questions?

text: MACBETH
Speak, if you can: what are you?
translation: MACBETH
Talk to us! What are you?

text: FIRST WITCH
All hail, Macbeth! hail to thee, thane of Glamis!
translation: FIRST WITCH
All hail Macbeth, the Thane of Glamis!

text: Second Witch
All hail, Macbeth, hail to thee, thane of Cawdor!
translation: SECOND WITCH
All hail Macbeth, the Thane of Cawdor!

text: Third Witch
All hail, Macbeth, thou shalt be king hereafter!
translation: THIRD WITCH
All hail Macbeth, who will soon be King of Scotland!

text: BANQUO
Are ye fantastical, or that indeed
translation: BANQUO
Are we just imagining you? Or are you

text: Which outwardly ye show? My noble partner
translation: actually real? To my friend, Macbeth,

text: You greet with present grace and great prediction
translation: you're giving all of these predictions of greatness

text: That he seems rapt withal: to me you speak not.
translation: that he can no longer speak out of amazement. Then you're ignoring me.

text: Speak then to me, who neither beg nor fear
translation: Tell me about my future. I'm not begging for any favors,

text: Your favours nor your hate.
translation: and I'm not afraid of your hate.

text: First Witch
Lesser than Macbeth, and greater.
translation: First Witch
You'll be lesser than Macbeth... and also greater than him.

text: Second Witch
Not so happy, yet much happier.
translation: Second Witch
You won't be as happy as him, but you'll end up much happier.

text: Third Witch
Thou shalt get kings, though thou be none.
translation: Third Witch
Your sons will be kings, but you won't be one.

text: So all hail, Macbeth and Banquo!
translation: So all hail to the both of you!

text: MACBETH
Stay, you imperfect speakers, tell me more.
translation: MACBETH
Wait, you haven't told us everything! Tell me more!

text: By Sinel's death I know I am thane of Glamis,
translation: I inherited the title Thane of Glamis when my father, Sinel, passed away.

text: But how of Cawdor? the thane of Cawdor lives,
translation: But how am I the Thane of Cawdor? He's still alive,

text: A prosperous gentleman; and to be king
translation: and doing well for himself. And being king

text: Stands not within the prospect of belief,
translation: isn't even possible for me!

text: No more than to be Cawdor. Say from whence
translation: Nor is it possible for me to be thane of Cawdor. From where

text: You owe this strange intelligence? or why
translation: did you get this strange information? Also, why

text: Upon this blasted heath you stop our way
translation: are you stopping us in the middle of nowhere

text: With such prophetic greeting? Speak, I charge you.
translation: just to tell us this? Answer me!

text: [The witches vanish]
BANQUO
The earth hath bubbles as the water has,
translation: BANQUO
I think that the land has bubbles like the water does,

text: And these are of them. Whither are they vanished?
translation: and they were from one of those. Where did they vanish to?

text: MACBETH
Into the air; and what seemed corporal melted
translation: MACBETH
They just vanished into the air. They looked real,

text: As breath into the wind. Would they had stay'd!
translation: but melted into nothing. I wish they had stayed!
